DOC.HEAD: London Shares End Higher
EDS: RECASTS throughout to UPDATE with later activity, closing indices; No pickup
DOC.TEXT: Share prices rose after a shortened session Friday on the London Stock Exchange, with most dealers and investors remaining on the sidelines before the long holiday weekend. At 3:30 p.m. local time, when the market officially closed, the Financial imes-Stock Exchange 100-share index was up 9.0 points, or 0.4 percent, at 2,362.0. The market normally closes at 5 p.m. Volume was a light 375.3 million shares, down from 438.0 million traded on Thursday. ``There have been one or two small buyers and no sellers,'' said one dealer. ``There's no real trade.'' Dealers said they didn't wish to take fresh trading positions ahead of the long weekend. British financial markets won't reopen until Wednesday. The Financial Times 30-share index was up 8.9 points at 1,862.2 at the close. The Financial Times 500-share index rose 3.43 points to close at 1,280.27.
